column4: While booting the live cd I get messages I/O buffer error on device dm-0. Any idea what this means? Looks like a HD problem (pc reboots while booting windows), but I can't find confirmation...
can you read your HD from the livecd?
and read, yes
check if you get errors in /var/log/messages
Just a basic question (I'm pretty new to linux/Ubuntu), device md-0 is always the HD?
while reading files from your hd, that is. dm-0 could give errors if you didn't use/install it, it's searching for LVM volumes
because HDs were hda, hdb, etc...
md0 is a "software raid" like device. dm-0 can be a "Logical Volume manager" device, think windows' Dynamic Disks
try to install smartmontools, then use smartctl -a -s on /dev/hda
ok, that's some more info I could use. Thanks. Now checking /var/log/messages (on another pc)... bbl...
Just checked /var/log/messages and it's a 170 kb file. Don't know where to start looking for usefull info...
you should open a terminal in the running Ubuntu, do a "sudo tail -f /var/log/messages" and then try to read files from the disk. In the terminal you could see disk errors, if they're there
tail doesn't stop spitting errors... even without starting to read from disk...
which kind of errors? Don't paste them here, use the pastebin in the topic, or open a private session with me
you should NOT paste logs here, use the pastebin
that said, your disk or your motherboard/controller is hosed ^^'
Doesn't sound good, motherboard/controler hosed...
it is not. I had a similar problem here, and I had to replace the disk
try to use the CD to recover as much files you can
USB drives/pendrives also could be of some use :-)
thanks for all the help, and the hint on the pastebin :-S
